summary:
What she says: I'm fine
What she means: Everybody is talking about season 8 of Game of Thrones but all I can think about is how...
body:
What she says: I’m fine

What she means: Everybody is talking about season 8 of Game of Thrones but all I can think about is how the writers slowly abandoned the originality of the first seasons in order to follow a dumbed-down plot (Which culminated in season 7 being a hot pile of garbage). And now I have a choice between never knowing how it ends or watching something I once loved deteriorate even further

summary: Six Sentence Sunday
title: Six Sentence Sunday
body: “For the Seven’s sake, Ned. Is he trustworthy or not? As for anything else – I’d think he would be an ideal company for a young maiden exactly because he is who he is. I am not sure I would trust Sansa in care of some of the younger and comelier men. You know how young girls can be,” Catelyn hissed, staring meaningfully at Ned.

reblog.comment: “For the Seven’s sake, Ned. Is he trustworthy or not? As for anything else – I’d think he would be an ideal company for a young maiden exactly because he is who he is. I am not sure I would trust Sansa in care of some of the younger and comelier men. You know how young girls can be,” Catelyn hissed, staring meaningfully at Ned.

I am not sure I would trust Sansa in care of some of the younger and comelier men. You know how young girls can be,” Catelyn hissed, staring meaningfully at Ned.

summary: Concept: after the war, Sansa and Theon become close friends from their shared experiences as being the Unfavorites of House...
body: Concept: after the war, Sansa and Theon become close friends from their shared experiences as being the Unfavorites of House Stark and their daddy issues, pointing out to each other how strong they are to overcome their hardships, because neither realizes they are at all but each can see it in the other.

summary: While everyone else is pitting Sansa and Daenerys against each other after that clip, I’m just here like: Wait? Daenerys and Jon...
body: While everyone else is pitting Sansa and Daenerys against each other after that clip, I’m just here like: Wait? Daenerys and Jon made it back to Winterfell. It’s safe to say the dead did not attack yet. Sansa is safe and well which means that Arya is most probably safe and well. So that means Arya and Jon reunion confirmed. It’s gonna happen! They are going to see each other again.

reblog.comment: While everyone else is pitting Sansa and Daenerys against each other after that clip, I’m just here like: Wait? Daenerys and Jon made it back to Winterfell. It’s safe to say the dead did not attack yet. Sansa is safe and well which means that Arya is most probably safe and well. So that means Arya and Jon reunion confirmed. It’s gonna happen! It’s safe to say the dead did not attack yet. Sansa is safe and well which means that Arya is most probably safe and well. So that means Arya and Jon reunion confirmed. It’s gonna happen! They are going to see each other again.

summary: Long Feng: Always keep your foes confused. If they are never certain who you are or what you want, they cannot know what you are...
body:
Long Feng: Always keep your foes confused. If they are never certain who you are or what you want, they cannot know what you are like to do next. Sometimes the best way to baffle them is to make moves that have no purpose, or even seem to work against you. Remember that, Joo Dee, when you come to play the game.
Joo Dee: What...what game?
Long Feng: The only game that matters. The game of thrones.

summary: I think we all should give Sophie Turner some more credit, she managed to send the entire fandom into a frenzy by being on...
body: I think we all should give Sophie Turner some more credit, she managed to send the entire fandom into a frenzy by being on screen for 2 seconds because she’s just that good at conveying exactly how Sansa feels about a foreign invader coming to take everything she fought and bled for

tags: the bad news is that those villains too stayed in the plot too long
but i'm ready to forgive that for angry sansa throwing  punches
summary: I just remembered that in both Martin’s stories involving Baelish-y variation of the villain, said villain is punched in the...
body: I just remembered that in both Martin’s stories involving Baelish-y variation of the villain, said villain is punched in the nose by local Sansa double and commits suicide soon after that. Since showrunners denied me such a glorious scene, I really hope GRRM will stay true to himself and write Sansa knocking out Baelish in righteous anger.

reblog.comment: I just remembered that in both Martin’s stories involving Baelish-y variation of the villain, said villain is punched in the nose by local Sansa double and commits suicide soon after that. Since showrunners denied me such a glorious scene, I really hope GRRM will stay true to himself and write Sansa knocking out Baelish in righteous anger.

Since showrunners denied me such a glorious scene, I really hope GRRM will stay true to himself and write Sansa knocking out Baelish in righteous anger.

Since showrunners denied me such a glorious scene, I really hope GRRM will stay true to himself and write Sansa knocking out Baelish in righteous anger.

summary: The Wreckers - Stand Still, Look Pretty
Here’s what I think will happen: Sansa yields Winterfell to Dany. It’s not a lie that is part of some elaborate scheme, at least...
body:
Here’s what I think will happen:

Sansa yields Winterfell to Dany. It’s not a lie that is part of some elaborate scheme, at least not on the part of Sansa. She has a bite to her tone because she isn’t thrilled about it, nor should she be. But she is doing what her king asked of her, and she knows what’s needed for the Great War. 

What this first scene does is prove to Jon that Sansa is there for him, no matter what, and will be loyal even if she needs to express frustration over it.

Jealousy is not what will break up Jon and Dany. Jealousy will not be what sparks Sansa’s scheming this season. Nothing petty here. Sansa is soooo far above that. So is Dany. Jealousy will only serve the purpose of planting seeds to help the characters and GA realize the “underlying tension” that will eventually be fully blown Jonsa.

What will break up Jon and Dany is the parentage/succession reveal. What will spark Sansa’s scheming is the need to help Jon keep the truth of his birthright under wraps for a multitude of reasons. Ultimately, shit will go down between the dragons, and Sansa will be there to help Jon.

Meanwhile, the threat that Sansa warned Jon about (Cersei) will strike against Sansa, Jon will feel like shit cuz she warned him, but he dismissed her concern as low priority, and as usual she was right. Jon will fight for Sansa, Sansa will fight for Jon, and in the end they will realize what they mean to each other.
